title: React Designs for my Portfolio site

bookmarks.description: Animated React Gallery - Design & Code by Dev Ed

Adding fetch api call

 

const fetchPopular = async () => {
// call movie database api
const data = await fetch(`https://get-movie-db-api.json`);
};

Map our API result to a state

 

// states
const [popular, setPopular] = useState([]);
...
...
...
// api call
const fetchPopular = async () => {
  // call movie database api
  const data = await fetch(`https://get-movie-db-api.json`);
  const movies = await data.json();
  setPopular(movies.result);
};
...
...
// side-effect
useEffect(()=>{
   fetchPopular();
}[]);

Creating our Movie Component - starter boilerplate

 

function Movie(){
  return(<div>
     <h2>Title</h2>
     <img src="" alt=""/>
  </div>);
}

export default Movie;

Creating CSS grid for the container and images within

 

.popular-movies {
   display:grid;
   grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minimal(250px, 1fr));
   grid-column-gap: 1rem;
   grid-row-gap: 2rem;
}

.popular-movies h2 {
  font-size: 0.8rem;
}
 
.popular-movies img {
  width: 100%;
  height: 30vh;
  object-fit: cover;
  border-radius: 1rem;
  margin-bottom: 1rem;
}

Now it's time to animate the cards

 

import {motion} from 'framer-motion';

Fix the weird stretching issue: 
+ In order to fix any weird Motion animation errors, you need to wrap your child components as well as with <motion.div layout>

 

// Movie.jsx
import {motion} from 'framer-motion';

function Movie({movie}) {
  return <motion.div layout>
  ....
  ...
  </motion.div>;
}

Adding Animations to Movie component

 

//Movie.js
<motion.div layout
   animate={{opacity: 1}}
   initial={{opacity: 0}}
   exit={{opacity: 0}}>
   <h2>Movie title</h2>
   <img .../>
</motion.div>

 

+ Even with this, the exit property doesn't get animated

+ For that we need to wrap this component with Motion's AnimatePresence component

AnimatePresence

+ As per the name suggestion, it will detects whenever a child dom node gets removed and it animates them

 

import {motion, AnimatePresence} from 'framer-motion';
...
...
<motion.div layout className="popular-movies">
   <AnimatePresence>
      {filtered.map((movie) => {
         return <Movie key={movie.id} movie={movie}/>
      })}
   </AnimatePresence>
</motion.div>

Adding Transition property to our animations

 

//Movie.js
<motion.div layout
   animate={{opacity: 1}}
   initial={{opacity: 0}}
   exit={{opacity: 0}}
   transition={{duration: 1}}>
   <h2>Movie title</h2>
   <img .../>
</motion.div>
